definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior

sentences.english: Many taggers merely want to have their name seen.
sentences.chinese: 许多“留名者”只是想让其名讳被看到而已。

definition: to address sb directly by name (idiom)/to address sb by name without using an honorific title (indicating either familiarity or overfamiliarity)
literary name (an alternative name of a person stressing a moral principle)/courtesy name
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior
honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
pet name for a child/infant name
what is your surname?/(May I ask) your surname?
two-character surname such as 司馬|司马 or 諸葛|诸葛
seniority in the family or clan/position in the family hierarchy
